intro: Bupleurum heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. Bupleurum heterophyllum is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,500 meters.
